segments.text: Hello, um, when is your next flight to London?
There's one leaving in 30 minutes, and I do have one seat left.
Oh, thank you, thank you, thank you!
The last-minute fare on this ticket is $2,700.
How about $600?
Sorry, how about $600 and these earrings?
They prefer it if I don't barter.
Well, I just don't think I have enough left on my credit card.
But you can split it with another credit card.
Okay, how about... how about 5?
I'm just going to need to see your passport.
Okay, you know what? I... I don't have it, but I can tell you exactly where it is—on my nightstand.
Okay, you know what? Okay, I have my... I have my driver's license, and I have a $20.
I'm back. Listen, I need to—
Hello? Hello? Um, I need to get on that 11:00 flight.
Oh, I'm afraid that plane has already pulled away from the gate.
Okay, you know what? You're going to have to call that plane and tell them to swing around and come and pick me up.
Can't do that.
Sure, you know what? Come on, we'll just tell them that there was, like, a problem with, like, the engine.
I'm afraid I'm going to have to ask you to step aside, Miss.
Look, if I don't get to London, he is going to marry that other girl!
Can't imagine why.
All right, you know what? I am not leaving here until you call that plane back!
